intro: Hieracium ferrimontanum, commonly known as the iron mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium ferrimontanum is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat.
